column4: gnome-terminal doesn't seem to want to read my .bash_profile automatically
because that would satisfy my expectations! :)
what do you want to do?
put it in the right file?  I still don't know what you are doing but ~/.profile or ~/.bashrc depending on that
how are you determining your ~/.bashrc isn't being read?
no, best to use the right files for what you want to do :)
if you read « man bash », you'll see ~/.bash_profile will only be read for login shells
yeah, I disable all that stuff in prefernecs
yeah, I didn't think urxvt started login shells by default
where exactly did you install this user-installed python?
